intro: Adenocalymma micradenium, commonly known as the small-flowered adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, woody fruits. It is typically found in sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Adenocalymma micradenium is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
